bioghist.head: Biographical/Historical note
bioghist.p: Mary DeSaussure Sobers, a track runner from the Brooklyn neighborhood of Bedford-Stuyvesant, became the first African American female to run in a sanctioned track meet when she participated in the Olympic Carnival, sponsored by the New York City Department of Parks, in 1945. She went on to have a successful track career and later became a coach and adviser to the Queens Trailblazers Track Club.

processinfo.head: Processing Information note

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: The Mary DeSaussure Sobers collection contains materials concerning Sobers's track career. Materials include correspondence, programs, publications, newspaper clippings, and photographs. Also included are three of Sobers's track medals from 1945.
